HEADER.name: SHARED HEADER
HEADER.description: Hader shared among all App11 messages

sets.name: REFERENCE
sets.description: Specifies identifying details regarding a document, image or other information exchange media that is applicable to the content of this message.

fields.name: SERIAL LETTER
fields.description: Enter the alphabetic character sequentially assigned by the message drafter

fields.name: COMMUNICATIONS TYPE
fields.description: Specifies the message identifier or the type of communication

ctrls.value:
CON
DOC
EML
LTR
MSG
TEL
VTC

fields.name: TITLE OF DOCUMENT
fields.description: Enter the title of the reference

fields.name: ORIGINATOR
fields.description: Enter the originator of the message, letter, or document referenced

fields.name: DATE AND OR TIME OF REFERENCE
fields.description: Specifies the date and/or time used to identify the reference

ctrls.value:
JAN
FEB
MAR
MAY
JUN
JUL
AUG
SEP
OCT
NOV
DEC

fields.name: REFERENCE SERIAL NUMBER
fields.description: Enter the message serial number or document serial numbe

fields.name: SPECIAL NOTATION
fields.description: Enter the special notation which applies to the referenced message

fields.name: SIC OR FILE NUMBER
fields.description: Provides further identifying details of the reference, repeating as necessary

sets.name: GEODETIC DATUM
sets.description: Provides geodetic datum reference for geographic locations in the message.

sets.name: PLACE DEFINITION
sets.description: Provides the geographical location of a place. To be used if place names are used in this message.

ctrls.note: Other PLACE types currently not supported

sets.name: HAZARD INFO
sets.description: This segment details the nature and location of the hazard

sets.name: EXERCISE IDENTIFICATION
sets.description: Provides the Exercise name. Identifies the Exercise the message pertains to. Not to be used in conjunction with set OPER.

fields.name: EXERCISE NICKNAME
fields.description: Enter the code name or nickname of the exercise to which the message pertains

fields.name: EXERCISE IDENTIFIER
fields.description: Provides additional information for the conduct of the exercise

sets.name: OPERATION CODEWORD
sets.example:
OPER/DENY FLIGHT//
OPER/DENY FLIGHT/SACEUR 106/PAPER WASTE/ORANGE//
OPER/PROVIDE VALUE/STRIKEFORSOUTH 202/-/LOW COST//
sets.description: Provides the Operation codeword. Identifies the Operation the message pertains to. Not to be used in conjunction with set EXER

fields.name: OPERATION CODEWORD
fields.description: Enter the assigned operation name or nickname as established by the appropriate authority

fields.name: PLAN ORIGINATOR AND NUMBER
fields.description: Enter the operation plan originator and numbe

fields.name: OPTION NICKNAME
fields.description: Enter the nickname of the primary option within the operation plan

fields.name: SECONDARY OPTION NICKNAME
fields.description: Enter the nickname of the secondary option within the operation plan

sets.name: MESSAGE IDENTIFIER
sets.description: Specifies the message identifier, message originator and other message identifying details.

fields.name: MESSAGE TEXT FORMAT IDENTIFIER
fields.description: Enter the Message Text Format identifier

fields.name: STANDARD
fields.description: Enter the publication that includes the formatted message specification

fields.name: VERSION
fields.description: Enter the change state of the publication that includes the formatted message specification

fields.name: ORIGINATOR
fields.description: Enter the message originator (normally in the short or standard abbreviated form)

fields.name: MESSAGE SERIAL NUMBER
fields.description: Enter the message serial number (numbering will be according to the instructions of the HQs or formation concerned)

fields.name: REFERENCE TIME OF PUBLICATION
fields.description: Provides the month or reference time of publication

fields.name: QUALIFIER
fields.description: Enter the code which caveats the message status

ctrls.value:
AMP
BLK
CHG
DEV
FIN
FUP
INI
NEW
PER
REQ
UPD

fields.name: SERIAL NUMBER OF QUALIFIER
fields.description: Enter the qualifier serial number (serially starting with 1 for first qualifier to any message)

fields.name: MESSAGE SECURITY POLICY
fields.description: Enter the security policy that applies to the information contained in the message

ctrls.value:
NATO UNCLASSIFIED
UNCLASSIFIED
NATO RESTRICTED
RESTRICTED
NATO CONFIDENTIAL
CONFIDENTIAL
NATO SECRET
SECRET
COSMIC TOP SECRET
TOP SECRET
OTHER CLASSIFICATION
NATO UNCLASSIFIED/PFP RELEASABLE
NATO RESTRICTED/PFP RELEASABLE
NATO CONFIDENTIAL/PFP RELEASABLE
NATO SECRET/PFP RELEASABLE

fields.name: MESSAGE CLASSIFICATION
fields.description: Provides the security classification of the message

ctrls.value:
UNCLASSIFIED
RESTRICTED
CONFIDENTIAL
SECRET
TOP SECRET

fields.name: MESSAGE SECURITY CATEGORY
fields.description: Enter the security category that applies to the information contained in the message

sets.name: HAZARD TYPE
sets.example:
GENTEXT/COMMANDERS ASSESSMENT/HERE YOU MAY ADD ANY COMMENTS IN FREE
TEXT OF AN UNLIMITED NUMBER OF CHARACTERS THAT IS REQUIRED BY THE
MESSAGE//
sets.description: Provides the hazard type details in free text.

fields.name: TEXT INDICATOR
fields.description: Enter the replacement name that is required for this set, for example: "COMMANDERS ASSESSMENT".

fields.name: FREE TEXT
fields.description: Enter in free text of an unlimited number of characters the comments that you wish to send to the other end.

sets.name: PERIOD OF TIME
sets.description: Provides the details for the period of time.

fields.name: START OF PERIOD
fields.description: Specifies the time that activities related to this period are required to start

fields.name: END OF PERIOD
fields.description: Specifies the time that activities related to this period set are required to stop

sets.name: AREA
sets.description: Defines the area which is dangerous to submarine operations.

fields.name: AREA NAME
fields.description: Enter the name of a pre-defined geographical area or the name to be assigned to the area defined by subsequent fields of the set

fields.name: BOUNDARY DEFINITION POINT
fields.description: Provides the geographic location of a point used in the area boundary definition

ctrls.note: Other POINT types currently not supported

sets.name: SECTOR DESCRIPTION
sets.description: Defines the sector which is hazardous for submarine operations.

sets.name: CIRCULAR AREA
sets.description: Defines the circular area which is hazardous for submarine operations.

sets.name: MOVEMENT OF THE UNIT
sets.description: Details the intended movement of the unit.

sets.name: PASSAGE PLAN
sets.description: oute. See message notes for an example of how this set is used in conjunction with the MOVAREA set.

fields.name: GEOGRAPHIC POSITION OF START FOR THE PASSAGE
fields.description: Provides the geographic location of start for the passage

ctrls.note: Other POINT types currently not supported

fields.name: DTG AT POSITION
fields.description: Enter the Date Time Group at that position

fields.name: POSITION OR POINT NAME
fields.description: Enter an identifying name for the position

sets.name: MOVEMENT AREA
sets.description: Specifies an area that a unit will remain in over a defined period. See message notes for an example of how this set is used in conjunction with the PASSAGE set.

fields.name: DTG OF ENTERING AREA
fields.description: Enter the Date Time Group when area will be entered

fields.name: DTG OF LEAVING AREA
fields.description: Enter the Date Time Group when unit will be leaving area

fields.name: AREA NAME
fields.description: Enter the name of a pre-defined geographical area or of an area defined by positions given in subsequent fields of the set

fields.name: GEOGRAPHIC POSITION
fields.description: Provides the geographic position information

ctrls.note: Other POINT types currently not supported
